intro: Campteria pseudolonchitis, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Due to its rapid growth and showy flowers, it is often used in landscaping and can become invasive in certain regions.
